page.title: 04GROSVENOR ESTATES:ABBEYSTEAD
page.content: Approximately half the properties in this area are owned by the Duke of Westminster-the Grosvenor Estates. These were purchased following the death of Lady Sefton, the last of the Molyneux family, in 1980. The land was bought primarily as a shooting estate and in the past much of the farmland was kept rougher and less well drained than that of owner occupiers, to give cover for birds. Rents were kept low by the Seftons who regarded the area as one to be conserved. This attitude is maintained by the Estates although drainage, fencing and land improvement has increased with more emphasis on commercial management. Farms here have often been tenanted by the same family for many generations. There is a feeling among the tenants of belonging to a family and smaller cottages are often let to retired estate workers.
